# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
play_round - Play the current round.
skip_round - Skip the current round. Boss blinds cannot be skipped.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.

reasoning:
**Balatro: Decision Time - Play the Round or Skip?**

Okay, so I'm at Ante 6, staring down a Big Blind that requires a hefty 30,000 chips. The reward? A measly $4.  But the real question is: skip for the Polychrome Tag?  This tag promises a free Polychrome Joker in the next base edition shop, giving a juicy x1.5 multiplier.

Right now, my Joker lineup is pretty solid. I've got: Odd Todd (good for chip generation with odd cards), Abstract Joker (a good flat multiplier), To The Moon (that extra interest is nice), a Gift Card (that juicy end-of-round sell value scaling is critical), The Tribe (x2 Flush multiplier), and Acrobat (x3 on the final hand).  My last play was a Flush, which is level 8, giving decent base chips and multiplier. I can easily hit 20k, let alone 30k.

My mind keeps going back and forth on the Polychrome Tag, though. It's a tempting buff, especially this late in the game, but Iâ€™ve got 6 jokers. That's max. If I take the tag, I have to sell one. Odd Todd is probably the weakest of the bunch right now. My Gift Card says it gives +1 joker slot, but I can't take another joker...

So, skipping means missing this shop, and going straight to the boss. After the Boss, I go to the shop. The tag will apply to the joker in that shop.

But wait. What's the value of playing the round? I get $4, plus interest, plus money from the hands. "To The Moon" increases my interest and "Gift Card" scales the value of all my cards at the end of the round.  Every round I miss is less Gift Card scaling and less shop value.

Let's look at the Boss: 1 in 7 cards get drawn face down. That makes fishing for a Flush harder, but not impossible.

Playing the round is the better play for scaling with Gift Card, but skipping nets me the Polychrome tag.

My build is already strong, and I can easily clear 30k in one or two hands. Polychrome is worth it if you have a weak joker, but I don't. The Gift Card scaling is my best bet. So let's play the round and keep scaling!

Action: `play_round`.
